Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Humorously \Hu"mor*ous*ly\, adv. 1. Capriciously; whimsically. [1913 Webster]
We resolve rashly, sillily, or humorously. --Calamy. [1913 Webster]
2. Facetiously; wittily. [1913 Webster]
humorously adv : in a humorous manner; "Dickens had humorously suggested a special service of intercession at St. Paul's Cathedral" [syn: {with humor}, {with humour}] [ant: {humorlessly}]
